title: Add LogEventLevel.None to mirror Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.LogLevel.None.
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I have an problem where I want serilog to log only logs from a specific provider and not any other ones.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
The solution would be to add ``None`` to ``LogEventLevel`` to disable a specific source (e.g category as known in Microsoft.Extensions.Logging).

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
I tried to disable them like so:

```cs
await Host.CreateDefaultBuilder()
    .UseContentRoot(Path.GetDirectoryName(executingAssembly.Location)!)
    .ConfigureLogging(logging => logging
        .AddFilter("Default", LogLevel.None))
        // .AddFilter("Remora.Discord.*", LogLevel.Warning))
        // .AddFilter("Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.*", LogLevel.None)
        // .AddFilter("Microsoft.Hosting.Lifetime", LogLevel.None)
        // .AddFilter("System.Net.Http.HttpClient.*.LogicalHandler", LogLevel.None)
        // .AddFilter("System.Net.Http.HttpClient.*.ClientHandler", LogLevel.None))
    .UseSerilog((hostingContext, services, loggerConfiguration) => loggerConfiguration
        // .ReadFrom.Configuration(hostingContext.Configuration)
        .MinimumLevel.Override("Remora.*", LogEventLevel.Warning)
        .Enrich.FromLogContext()
        .WriteTo.File(
            DiscordBotSingleton.GetDiscordLogFileName()))
    .ConfigureServices((hostContext, collection) =>
        DiscordBotSingleton.ConfigureServices(hostContext, collection)
            .AddHostedService<ConsoleHostedService>())
    .RunConsoleAsync();
```

where my attempt with to use ``.ConfigureLogging()``. to add a filter to disable them, but use serilog to override the ``Remora.*`` categories to ``LogEventLevel.Warning``.

**Additional context**

Not available at the moment.
